WRITING.TEXT: Cafe Spot in Alhambra is my absolute favorite. The boba there is heaven and so's the fried tofu.
Follow Your Heart in Canoga Park is awesome. It's not all vegan, but mostly. There's both vegan and dairy versions of the food there. They also don't serve meat.
My friend has a friend named Loaf. Who names their child after bread?
Rule no. 1: no lying with your hips. Hips don't lie.
It's recent, but Get Out. I saw it and I fell in love. Such a good plot that hasn't been too overdone. Just the right amount of scary without it seeming forced.
I'd probably end up with 10 million dolls instead of 10 million dollars.
Veronica Mars. I own all 3 season box sets (with behind the scenes features and stuff). And yes, I know it's 2016 and pretty much everything is online, but I don't care.
Texted the guy I hooked up with the previous night instead of my best friend. Haven't talked to that guy since...
If you really want it, then get it.
An airplane that big? I don't even live near an airport.

I had a thyroidectomy when I was 11. There was like a 1/200 chance that my vocal cords would be cut by accident during the surgery since the thyroid and vocal cords are literally right next to each other.
Edit: My vocal cords are fine.
Well the other night I had two decisions: masturbate or read more of The Shining. I chose to read because goddamn, that book has sucked me in.
One time I told my boss at my old job that I ate bad sushi and had food poisoning and couldn't come in. I don't eat sushi, but he doesn't have to know that...
My friend lives on a street called Zelzah Avenue and his wifi has the name "Legend of Zelzah."
Pizza... And I know someone who actually does eat it like that.

One time I was sitting in my kitchen eating lunch and looking out the window. It was super sunny outside--not a single cloud in the sky. Then, all of a sudden, almost like a reverse camera flash, the sun dimmed, but in a flash. It was like someone clicked a camera shutter, but instead of lighting everything up, everything was darkened. The whole thing lasted about 3-5 seconds and holy shit I was so confused. I think I posted about it the day that it happened, but everyone was like, "lol ever heard of clouds?" And it's like, yeah, but that doesn't explain how it flashed. With clouds it's kind of like dimming a light, where it dims gradually, but this was like sunny, not sunny, then sunny again within a few seconds. I have no idea how to explain that.
**TL;DR: The sky flashed right before my eyes on a perfectly sunny day with no clouds.**

I've posted this on several threads in the past and I think I'm gonna do a YouTube video or a few YouTube videos because I've had so many downright weird experiences.
I just wanna say that in my old house, I'm pretty sure it was the spirit of a young girl (my mom and I heard a little girl say, "mamma?" in the middle of the night on one occasion I'm an only child). I'd also always find toys laid out in my room after leaving the room for a few minutes. I'd come back in and where there wasn't before, there'd be a stuffed animal on the floor in the middle of my room. This kept happening on multiple occasions over the span of like 6 or 7 years. And not only toys would move, but random objects. I was about to go to bed one night and decided to put eyedrops in. I had the eyedrops in my hand and a tissue box right next to me on the night stand. So I put the eyedrops in and I reach for a tissue to wipe my eyes, but the tissue box isn't there anymore. I was really confused because it had JUST been there. Then I sit up and see the tissue box on the other side of my room on my dresser. This happened in the span of about 5-10 seconds. I also had the door to my room shut, so there was no way that my mom or dad could've walked in without me hearing or seeing them. Then I thought, "Oh, good. The ghost is trolling me."
Edit: I don't live in that house anymore. I moved out when I was 14. The tissue box thing happened a few weeks before my parents and I moved out.
The days of the month rhyme that I learned in 3rd grade: 30 days has September, April, June, November. All the rest have 31, except for February, all alone.
Thomas Was Alone. That game sucked me in real bad. I got a 100% completion rate last week and I already miss playing it.
Flexibility. Sometimes when people see me stretch and do the splits and stuff they'll joke saying that I'm probably really good in bed. However, I can't really be the judge of that...
I'm the giver of belly rubs.
The video store scene in Clerks where Randal is ordering a bunch of movies (https://youtu.be/b8H7wUKryrw)
